answers.answer: Im glad your MD is happy with your numbers... what are they?What are normal Numbers?Your MD does NOT pay the price for having BG too high      YOU DO!the price of too high BG can often cause diabetic macular edema.  people with normal BG 65 to 120 dont get diabetic macular edema.Diabetes does NOT have to lead to complications  having normal BG reduces the risk of complications.what diabetes meds are you on?
only on 1000metformin twice a day.I think they said it was 7.5 which was ok or at least satisfactory because a year ago it was 19

That is a great improvement, dont stop there.  Having an A1c of 19 means yu were probly diabetic for a long time and with high numbers.  sounds like you allergic to something (Met?)  I dont know I am NOT an MD
I think you should speak with you doctor and request a blood panel for liver function.  Extreme itch and turning yellow can point to problems in that area
I think you should speak with you doctor and request a blood panel for liver function.  Extreme itch and turning yellow can point to problems in that area

thankyousince my last post I have seen a dermatologist and they have prescribe some steroid cream which is really helping to control the itch and I have had  biopsy  on my skin which I am waiting to get results from . I have a appointment on the 24th April with a consultant so hopefully I can post the outcome then.

question: well this terrible itching all over my body continues. had two lots of antihistamines and cream which eases it slightly but not curing it . my body is a mass of scars and two weeks ago I had a weeks course of antibiotics because I had a red swollen leg caused by the scratching. My partner says my back has a yellow tinge to it. Now I have little water blisters appearing on my legs. can anybody through light on what could by wrong. I am type2 diabetic [and have been for 15years] with reasonable levels and the doctor is satisfied with that. I also take a tablet for recent albuminium in urine but the itching started before I started on them. I also have been having lucentis injections in the eye recently.
title: itch
